page.title: 08Agriculture
page.content: The river Ouse forms a clear division of the agriculture in the area. To the west of the Ouse and north of the river Wharfe is permanent grassland. This is grazed by dairy cattle, mainly Friesian cross breeds, and French cross breeds, and mown for hay and silage. Further from the river on the higher land are small areas of cereal crops.{ { { East of the river is an arable area {where wheat, barley, oats, sugar beet, {oil seed rape and potatoes are grown {in rotation. The riverside grassland {is grazed by beef cattle. One farmer {rears sheep. { }
